refnamediv.refpurpose: Userspace upcall helper for Common Internet File System (CIFS)

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: This tool is part of the samba 7 suite.

cifs.upcall is a userspace helper program for the linux CIFS client filesystem. There are a number of activities that the kernel cannot easily do itself. This program is a callout program that does these things for the kernel and then returns the result.

cifs.upcall is generally intended to be run when the kernel calls request-key8 for a particular key type. While it can be run directly from the command-line, it's not generally intended to be run that way.

listitem.para: When handling a kerberos upcall, use a service principal that starts with "cifs/". The default is to use the "host/" service principal.

refsect1.title: CONFIGURATION FOR KEYCTL
refsect1.para: cifs.upcall is designed to be called from the kernel via the request-key callout program. This requres that request-key be told where and how to call this program. The current cifs.upcall program handles two different key types:

listitem.para: This keytype is for retrieving kerberos session keys
This key type is for resolving hostnames into IP addresses

refsect1.para: To make this program useful for CIFS, you'll need to set up entries for them in request-key.conf5. Here's an example of an entry for each key type:
refsect1.programlisting: #OPERATION TYPE D C PROGRAM ARG1 ARG2... #========= ============= = = ========================================== create cifs.spnego * * /usr/local/sbin/cifs.upcall -c %k create dns_resolver * * /usr/local/sbin/cifs.upcall %k
refsect1.para: See request-key.conf5 for more info on each field.
